FUNC.NAME: RawSensors
FUNC.SYNOPSIS: is used to retrieve the raw data values of the specified sensors.

PARAM.NAME: getSensorData
PARAM.DESC: This immediately returns the raw data of the specified sensors via the sensorEvent

PARAM.DESC: This enables/disables the accelerometer sensor data retrieval.

PARAM.NAME: minimumInterval
PARAM.DESC: The minimum amount of time gap between two sensor update events, specified in milliseconds. The interval cannot be set to less than 200 milliseconds, if a value of less than 200 milli seconds is specified, the interval will be defaulted to 200 milli seconds.

TAG.TAG_NOTES: The sensorEvent event is triggered when a parameter of the specfiied sensors is changed.

COMMENT.COMMENT_DATA: Since the json object returned by the event contains the data for all of the sensors if a sensor is not enabled or absent then that data is undefined (null) and should not be used.
As some of the sensor values change rapidly the minimum interval between two updates should be specified as a reasonable value, otherwise there can be a performance impact.

As this plugin returns the raw sensor values reported by the operating system the values might differ between platforms. Which sensors are supported on which platform are dependant on the hardware available on the device.

On iOS devices and non Symbol Technologies Windows Mobile/CE devices, only the Ruby interface is currently available. On all Android and Symbol Technologies devices all language interfaces are supported.

ADDITIONAL.PLATFORM: All supported devices. On Windows this is only supported in MPA3.0 devices.
